metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1521 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
analyzer/protocol/dnp3/DNP3.cc in Bro before 2.3.2 does not properly handle zero values of a packet length, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow or buffer over-read if NDEBUG; otherwise assertion failure) via a crafted DNP3 packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1521` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bro - 2.5-1
bro-common - 2.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bro package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5-1').
